intro: Otites sibiricus subsp. kleopovii, commonly known as the Siberian bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in arid and semi-arid regions. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in late summer. Otites sibiricus subsp. kleopovii is often cultivated for its ornamental value and hardy nature.
